bioghist.p: Villanova University's College of Liberal Arts and Sciences is home to a number of academic centers and institutes dedicated to promoting the mission of the College within their area of concentration. In addition to offering courses, centers and institutes in the College host lectures and other special events and may publish a journal. The Augustinian Institute serves the University as an agent and resource to support its efforts to give Augustine's thought a vibrant and integral place within Villanova's academic and community life, and allows that voice of Augustine to continue to speak effectively to todayâ€™s world. Between the late 1950s and the mid 1970s, Villanova, supported by grants from the National Science Foundation, conducted an institute offering courses in mathematics and science for secondary school teachers. These courses were conducted in the summer and fall on the University's campus.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of Villanova University's Institutes. Currently, the collection contains materials from two Institutes: the National Science Foundation Institute and the Augustinian Institute. Records of the National Science Foundation Institute include correspondence related to the NSF Summer Institute (1964); brochures for the In-Service Institute (1959-1973) and the Summer Institute (1959, 1962-1966); and reports and participant lists of the NSF In-Service Institute (1959-1973). Records of the Augustinian Institute include correspondence, announcements, and news clippings on the Institute (1962-1971); and brochures for the Patristic, Mediaeval, and Renaissance Studies conference (1997-2000).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
